raw: As you gaze over a many-eyed stone trinket, you realize that ANALYZE may provide you with more of the finer details.
The trinket can not be worn.
Analysis of a many-eyed stone trinket indicates the creator has provided the following information:
When REDEEMed, this trinket will grant a custom major sanctuary to your character:
[Chamber of Ocularity]

Twisted candelabra made of crimson-stained bone cast flickering shadows across the darkness, revealing an asymmetrical stone chamber covered in carvings of eyes.  An enormous, lifelike painting towers over the area, depicting a slimy grey, tentacular humanoid with three eyes.  The creature's mouth is agape to reveal dozens of sharp teeth, each tipped with a tiny, unblinking eye.  Dark fog roils across the floor in a neverending undulation.

Entry Message: Dark fog envelops you, its dense greyness broken only by the blurry images of hundreds of eyes staring at you.  The world around you fades completely, until all you see are eyes and fog...
Exit Message: Dark fog wraps about you, hiding you from all the eyes.  The chamber grows dim about you...
The stone trinket will cost 500,000 coins.

items.name: an interwoven eahnor choker with stygian lichstone spacers

raw: Analysis of an interwoven eahnor choker with stygian lichstone spacers indicates the creator has provided the following information:
--LOOK AT ME JEWELRY--
~General Script Information~
This is special jewelry that indicates more precise locations of where and how it is being worn in messaging.
It can have a separate description when it is worn, allowing more flexibility in how it looks.
For example, a ring using this script could indicate it was being worn on the left thumb in its worn description.
Each type of jewelry can only be set to specific positions.
Jewelry can have "sides" unlocked to store more designs/specific positions.
This choker is currently unlocked to: Tier 1 of 2 (OTS)
At this tier, this choker has access to the verbs: WEAR, REMOVE, WAVE (targeted/untargeted).
This choker currently has access to 1 side.
~Alteration Guidelines~
* Alterations to the 15/15/15, long and show of this item can be freely altered.
* This item can have separate descriptions when being worn, as well as when being held.
* Any willing merchant should be able to change the specific position this item can be worn, but not the main area it is worn on.
For example, a ring could be changed to be worn on the left index finger, but NOT be changed to be worn on the wrist.
~Current Settings~
* This item is meant to be worn around the neck, with the specific wear location being on the neck (tight fit/choker).
Possible specific wear positions for this type of item are: loose fit, tight fit/choker.
* Unworn 15/15/15: an interwoven,eahnor,choker
* Worn 15/15/15: an interwoven,eahnor,choker
* Worn Long Description: an interwoven eahnor choker with stygian lichstone spacers worn tightly around the neck [Default]
The eahnor choker will cost 300,000 coins.

items.name: a smoothly polished bracer of dark-flecked blue lapis lazuli

raw: Secured along the back of the bracer is a slender, hand blown crystal vial bearing a delicate stopper.
Analysis of a smoothly polished bracer of dark-flecked blue lapis lazuli indicates the creator has provided the following information:
The polished bracer is a piece of perfume-holding jewelry that currently holds no current scent.
When applied via PULL, this bracer will apply the scent with gendered messaging.  RUB will always be gender neutral.

It may be altered with a long or a show, but must remain a piece of jewelry.  The stoppered crystal vial will always remain on the piece.  Please note that acceptable jewelry items are only items worn as pins, around the neck, on the arm (like a vambrace), or on the wrist.  No back pendants, no anklets, no earrings.
The polished bracer will cost 75,000 coins.
As you gaze over a haon horse trinket, you realize that ANALYZE may provide you with more of the finer details.
The trinket can not be worn.
Analysis of a haon horse trinket indicates the creator has provided the following information:
When REDEEMed, this trinket will grant a custom major sanctuary to your character:
[Serene Stable]

Wrought iron-caged lanterns, hanging from exposed rafters crossing the peaked roof, cast a warm glow over a cobblestone aisle lightly strewn with straw.  Occasionally letting out a soft nicker, horses rustle in the hay within the uniform, haon-framed stalls on either side.  A polished leather saddle waits upon a stand, and oiled bridles drape from hooks on square support beams.

Entry Message: Your vision becomes fuzzy, like a thick fog rolling in. As the haze begins to clear, the whinnying of a horse welcomes you, and the aroma of fresh sawdust and oiled leather rises around you
Exit Message: A sad nicker bades farewell as the mists overtake you...
The horse trinket will cost 1,250,000 coins.

This is a prize token that, once REDEEMed, will:
Grant the ability to cast a customized Miracle (350) involving whispered chanting.

First Person: A sourceless breath of hot, dry air swirls around you, tugging at your dead body and sliding through your spectral form.  It carries with it whispers that resolve into a hissing chant you hear not with your ears but with your very soul.  As the wind-borne chant reaches a crescendo, your heart begins to beat again, and you feel the hot air rasping across your skin for a moment before the current settles.

Others' View: A sourceless breath of hot, dry air begins to swirl around Brodega's dead body.  Hissing whispers are carried on the wind, only faintly audible.  As the wind-borne chant peaks, the air currents settle and Brodega stirs.

This item does NOT grant spell knowledge.  REDEEMing this item assumes that the player already has the ability to cast the customized spell either from an item, Spell Knowledge, or having the spell cast upon you, if applicable.

The butterfly can not be worn.
Analysis of a glass-encased red glider butterfly indicates the creator has provided the following information:

A talented merchant can alter this weavable butterfly.  Merchants will require that the butterfly can logically be woven together with a duplicate of itself or other weavable items and make sense for eventually forming an item like a garland or anklet.  Appropriate items are flowers, ribbons, leaves, string, and the like.  Nothing big/bulky.  No "gemstone-mimic" weavables (if it can be confused with an actual gemstone, then it's a no go).  No long and show descriptions are allowed at this time.

When weaving, only the adjective and noun, and sometimes part of the article, will matter, so bear this in mind.  Right now, this butterfly, when woven, will show up as a "glass-encased red glider butterfly," and if there is more than one, you will end up with some "glass-encased red glider butterflies."
To get the full benefit of this butterfly, you can try to WEAVE it WITH another similarly weavable item.  You can also BUNDLE (and BUNDLE REMOVE) identical items.
The red glider butterfly will cost 7,500 coins.
The pewter ferroniere has an empty setting that looks ready to have a gem pushed into it.
Analysis of a multi-chained pewter ferroniere indicates the creator has provided the following information:
This is the Racial Ferroniere that was first released in 5108 as part of the cultural and racial carts that wandered Mist Harbor.  It can only ever be altered into the following:
Aemikvai   - Giant          - The stone is always carved with a Saramar rune, and the setting is intricate knotwork.
Basrenne   - Forest Gnome   - Chain of woven or linked reeds which can be dyed. Gem is in its mostly natural state.
Elothrai   - Erithi         - Always uses an agate or an agita for the gem.
Ferrigem   - Burghal Gnome  - Chain uses bits and pieces of different metals, gem is in slivers or a shard, and a tiny gear or gadget is worked in somewhere.
Geldaralad - Elves          - Requires a twisted vaalin chain.
Khazurka   - Dwarf          - Mithril chain, cut gem, often very detailed.
Seer-stone - Human          - Oval-cut stone turned lengthwise to resemble a third eye.
Trinette   - Halfling       - Tri-stranded chain, trilliant-cut gem, and an elaborate setting.
For more information on the details of Ferroniere's you can go to:
https://gswiki.play.net/Ferroniere
Alter Instructions:
Please make sure that you remove the gemstone before giving this to an alterer to customize for you.
Please adhere to the rules above regarding this item.
Verbs: look, push (with gem in hand), pull (with empty hand), wear, and remove
The pewter ferroniere will cost 200,000 coins.

items.name: a tightly woven vaalin ferroniere dangling an iridescent geode druzy stone

raw: The vaalin ferroniere has an iridescent geode druzy stone nestled into its setting.  It appears that a firm pull would unseat the stone.
Analysis of a tightly woven vaalin ferroniere dangling an iridescent geode druzy stone indicates the creator has provided the following information:
This is the Racial Ferroniere that was first released in 5108 as part of the cultural and racial carts that wandered Mist Harbor.  It can only ever be altered into the following:
Aemikvai   - Giant          - The stone is always carved with a Saramar rune, and the setting is intricate knotwork.
Basrenne   - Forest Gnome   - Chain of woven or linked reeds which can be dyed. Gem is in its mostly natural state.
Elothrai   - Erithi         - Always uses an agate or an agita for the gem.
Ferrigem   - Burghal Gnome  - Chain uses bits and pieces of different metals, gem is in slivers or a shard, and a tiny gear or gadget is worked in somewhere.
Geldaralad - Elves          - Requires a twisted vaalin chain.
Khazurka   - Dwarf          - Mithril chain, cut gem, often very detailed.
Seer-stone - Human          - Oval-cut stone turned lengthwise to resemble a third eye.
Trinette   - Halfling       - Tri-stranded chain, trilliant-cut gem, and an elaborate setting.
For more information on the details of Ferroniere's you can go to:
https://gswiki.play.net/Ferroniere
Alter Instructions:
Please make sure that you remove the gemstone before giving this to an alterer to customize for you.
Please adhere to the rules above regarding this item.
Verbs: look, push (with gem in hand), pull (with empty hand), wear, and remove
The vaalin ferroniere will cost 25,000 coins.

In the Common language, it reads:
This note can be REDEEMed to increase an appropriate item's capacity by 10 pounds up to a maximum of:
Back and shoulder containers: 160 pounds
Slung on shoulder containers: 70 pounds
Torso, attached to belt, and front containers: 50 pounds
NOTE: If your item's capacity limit is lower than the service amount, the item is ineligible.
Tiny and extremely tiny containers are also ineligible for use with this note.
The note can not be worn.
Analysis of a light pink note indicates the creator has provided the following information:

This pink note can be REDEEMed to increase the capacity of a worn container (back, shoulder, slung on shoulder, torso, attached to belt, and front) by 10 pounds.  Containers worn in other locations are not eligible for this note.

Please note that in some cases, this increase may change your item from non-functional to functional.  In addition, any items restricted to hold a specific number of items (ie: your container will only hold one item) will still only hold X number of items.  This note will not change that.  Normal restrictions will apply and may vary from item to item.
Some scripted items are eligible for redemption with this pink note.
A light pink note is a single-use note.
HUG your note to see a list of denied scripts.
The pink note will cost 500,000 coins.

items.name: a brass and gold capsule with a glass dome

raw: The brass and gold capsule is divided into two halves, with the top portion being crafted from glass and the bottom portion wrought from brass and gold.  Through the transparent glass, ten chambers are exposed inside the capsule, each detailed with a miniature replica of the cities and towns across Elanthia.  A glowing ring surrounds the chamber for Wehnimer's Landing currently.  It appears that the capsule can hold 30 Chronomage spheres in each chamber.  An enruned opening is situated between both halves of the capsule.  The brass and gold capsule contains no brass and gold spheres in the Wehnimer's Landing chamber.
The capsule can not be worn.
Analysis of a brass and gold capsule with a glass dome indicates the creator has provided the following information:

This is a container to hold your Chronomage spheres.  The spheres must NOT be attuned to you, used in a waiting room, or have an expirations.  This capsule holds 30 spheres in each chamber.  This can be expanded to hold more by special vouchers or rare merchants that will dabble in such arts.
Usage:
LOOK at MY capsule            - Look at the chambers inside.
PUT {sphere} [in] MY capsule  - Insert a sphere inside the proper chamber.
PUSH MY capsule               - Eject a sphere from inside the capsule.
TURN MY capsule               - Change which chamber it is set to.
RUB MY capsule                - Reveal the contents of each chamber instantly.
The brass and gold capsule will cost 5,000,000 coins.
It is estimated to be worth about 100,000 silvers.
It is magic resistant.
It is predominantly crafted of metal.
It has a temporarily unlocked loresong by Nihrvanah.

Welcome to Warmages Anonymous!

The dark red bloodjewel-set leathers and deep green faenor-edged leathers are both 4x doubles.

sign: Written on a sea blue wave-etched sign:
Welcome to Warmages Anonymous!
Everything in this room has been sung to. Attempt to GET the items to see their properties.
Items of Note:
Most of the weapons here are forged by our resident master blacksmith, Aetheri.
The rolaren khopesh, rolaren waraxe, vaalorn long knife and veil iron-hilted eonake warsword are superior forged.
All other items save for the runestaff and crossbow are elegant forged.
All the eonake weapons are sanctified.
Be sure to INSPECT everything before purchasing.

raw: Masterfully crafted of sturdy rolaren, this formidable weapon is a perfect example of the rarely achieved balance between stout functionality and elegant design.  Chatoyant rolaren in hues of forest green and gold forms the head, smoothly meeting edges of veil iron.  Flowing Ardenai runes etched in the blade spiral down the sturdy veil iron haft which finishes in a polished sphere of emerald blazestar marked with the crest of House Ardenai.  It has a small enchanter's glyph and Aetheri's crafting mark.  A strong aura of holy light radiates from the waraxe.
There appears to be something written on it.
You try to read a sharp runic Ardenai waraxe, but the language is not one you know.  It looks like it's written in Elven.
Analysis of a sharp runic Ardenai waraxe indicates the creator has provided the following information:
This is a Premium Autoscripter Edged Weapons - Option 1.
Alteration Restrictions: It should not be altered into something broken, dull, or weak-looking as the messaging is for weapons of superior craftsmanship.
Verb Traps: CLENCH, DUST, GAZE, LEAN, PULL, PUSH, RAISE, TAP, TILT, and WAVE.  There is nothing to unlock.
The Ardenai waraxe will cost 55,000,000 coins.
It is forged by Aetheri and has increased (+2) effectiveness in combat.
It is estimated to be worth about 25,550,000 silvers.
It is predominantly crafted of rolaren.
It has been sanctified 5 times.  It has permanent Holy Fire flares.

This is a prize token that, once REDEEMed, will:

Grant the ability to cast a customized Well of Life (308) of: dappled light spilling on your face through rustling leaves.  You must have knowedge of this spell to use it.  At this time, redemption of this customization will PERMANENTLY disable default messaging of this spell.

Important note:
The effect of this token is cosmetic.  It does not increase the effect or damage caused by a spell.

This item does NOT grant spell knowledge.  REDEEMing this item assumes that the player already has the ability to cast the customized spell either from an item, Spell Knowledge, or having the spell cast upon you, if applicable.

items.name: a full-skirted dark cranberry-hued gown of lush burnt velvet

raw: Analysis of a full-skirted dark cranberry-hued gown of lush burnt velvet indicates the creator has provided the following information:

A full-skirted dark cranberry-hued gown of lush burnt velvet cannot be detailed to indicate that it is anything but long.  It cannot be altered to indicate that the lower portion of the garment (below the knees) is tight-fitting in any way; the upper portion can be, but not the lower.

The a full-skirted dark cranberry-hued gown of lush burnt velvet can be customized in the following manner, where any talented merchant can customize the bolded sections.  Note that customizations cannot use speech:
(STAND) Standing primly you fluff the fabric of your gown out until it drapes down in a perfectly smooth and unblemished fashion.
(PUSH) You push your hands down against your gown in an elegant gesture.
Currently, you are able to use STAND, RUB, PUSH, TURN.  A very few talented merchants are able to unlock this gown further.
The cranberry-hued gown will cost 200,000 coins.

Analysis of a plush porraye-lined evergreen lyraigne cloak indicates the creator has provided the following information:

This is a Peretta Cloak.  A plush porraye-lined evergreen lyraigne cloak cannot be detailed to indicate that it is completely skin-tight or that it isn't long enough to "billow up" in certain situations, but it is otherwise able to be altered, so long as it remains a cloak or cloak-like item.

The a plush porraye-lined evergreen lyraigne cloak can be customized in the following manner, where any talented merchant can customize the bolded sections.  Note that customizations cannot use speech:
(RUB) You fiddle with the edges of your lyraigne cloak in a fit of nervous energy.
(STAND) You push back your lyraigne cloak and immediately shift into a relaxed stance.
Currently, you are able to use RUB, STAND, TURN, and NUDGE.  A very few talented merchants are able to unlock this cloak further.
The lyraigne cloak will cost 300,000 coins.

items.name: some long flowing silk robes tied with a silver cord

raw: You determine that the flowing silk robes is an armor concealing garment that will hide leather, scale, chain mail and plate mail armor which covers torso, arms and legs when it is worn.
Analysis of some long flowing silk robes tied with a silver cord indicates the creator has provided the following information:
The flowing silk robes is designed to hide leather, scale, chain mail and plate mail armor which covers torso, arms and legs.
This garment should be designed in such a manner to convey that ALL these areas are completely covered.
You carefully analyze your flowing silk robes and sense that there are some alteration restrictions.  The robes can have either a long or a show description.

Any outer garment noun may be used for armor concealers as long as they are loose fitting and fully cover the appropriate areas of protection (tunics do not cover legs, so they may not cover leg worn armor, a shawl would not be appropriate at all, etc.).
Armor concealers that cover the head MUST have a hood/cowl in the base (15/15/15) and in any long descriptions.
Armor concealers can be made out of any material that is not see-through.
Racial clothing nouns are approved as follows:
Ruhan ~ This garment is knee-length or shorter and should not have a hood, so it cannot cover armor with leg or head protection.  This concealer cannot be pocketed.
Toque ~ This noun is approved for any armor and may have a hood.

Cotehardie ~ This noun may be used but must clearly be an outer garment that falls to the knees (so it cannot cover armor with leg protection) and is not-tight fitting.  It should be used as an elven outer garment, not a gown.
Apotl/Apotla ~ These are fine for concealers, but since it is a waist-length cloak, it only covers torso and arms.
Atanika/Ataniki ~ These nouns are approved for concealers but should not have a hood.
The flowing silk robes will cost 1,000,000 coins.

Its face is carved in haggard lines, while almond-shaped eyes are fitted with jade green and reign over its hawkish nose.

Plainly, a master artisan was responsible for the creation of this silver-sheened mask.  The strong, muscular face is framed in incredibly short seafoam green hair shorn close to the scalp and dotted with bone-white barnacles, which have partially burrowed into the skin.  There are no eyeholes; instead, narrow, white-pupiled ebon eyes are painted upon the mask.  An intricate arcane sigil has been incised just above the wide, flaring nose.
Analysis of a barnacled seafoam green mask indicates the creator has provided the following information:

This is a feature changing mask.  It will temporarily change your features for three hours.  If you look at this mask, you will see how it will change your features.  Once the time is up, it will fall off.  If your hands are both full, it will drop to the ground.  Please make sure that you highlight this mask in some fashion so that you can track it.
This is what it will look like when the mask falls off:
Your facial features slowly grow heavy and seem to harden.  Without warning, something solid and smooth slips from your face and tumbles into your free hand.
The seafoam green mask will cost 400,000 coins.

items.name: a metallic clockwork rolton etched with fleece-like whorls

raw: Comprised of brass gears and copper screws, the body is fashioned of bronze rods molded into the shape of a rolton.  Slender etch-marks on the sides are whorls and swirls that mimic a curly fleece, while molded and stitched bits of leather form the ears.  A pair of sodalite eyes stare out from behind hooded lids fabricated of suede.

Analysis of a metallic clockwork rolton etched with fleece-like whorls indicates the creator has provided the following information:
Happy New Year 5124!
Clicking, clacking, and whirring into the the 5124 New Year, the rolton is a farewell to the 5123 theme of Year of the Rolton and a greeting to the 5124 theme of Year of the Clockwerke Devices.
This is a purely fluff toy.
Verb Traps are: flip, kiss, look, poke, prod, push, raise, rub, and tilt
You may alter the rolton, though it must remain metal.  It can only have a LONG description and its stock LOOK will never change.
The clockwork rolton doesn't belong to you.
The clockwork rolton will cost 99,999 coins.

Silver cotton cording is woven into a simple bracelet that is strung with two ivory ovals.  Each bead-like piece is the bas-relief image of a deity standing within a domed shrine.  One clutches a crescent moon in her hand, while the other holds a sickle.  Deep gouges mar the features making their faces unrecognizable.  A single flat disk, etched with a chelioboros, is attached to the space where the braided cords are bound together.
In the Common language, it reads:
Salvation lies only within Him.

Analysis of a murky glass vial indicates the creator has provided the following information:
This glass vial is intended to be a ritualistic potion of some sort.  You can try to POUR, TURN, TILT, DRINK, and MEASURE it.

Some skilled merchants can alter this vial.  It can have a long or a show description, though generally the visible description should match up in some way with its contents.  Ideally, the noun is a container (since you are pouring out of it), though in some cases something more generic like "potion" will be acceptable.  You should also be explicit with the merchant about what sort of liquid is contained within it.  The liquid will always need to make sense within this phrasing:  "a circular stain of <liquid descriptor> <liquid noun>" -- and it must be appropriate for pouring out and leaving a visible stain on the ground, such as "blood", "venom," and things of that nature.  Note that the <liquid noun> must fit within 15 characters.  The <liquid descriptor> can be longer but most merchants will not allow counts to go too far beyond 15.  (Currently the liquid is:  crimson blood.)
The glass vial will cost 99,999 coins.
There is nothing to read on the certificate.
The certificate can not be worn.

This green smoke certificate will add the custom spell prep script to an [unscripted] object.
The target item must be able to be worn in the slot:  Wrist
The target item will allow you to cast the Grasp of the Grave spell with the following messaging:
First person:  As you hold your spell prep prop high and incant Grasp of the Grave, plumes of noxious green smoke spill from your fist and seep into the earth beneath you...
Third person:  As Brodega holds his spell prep prop high and incants Grasp of the Grave, plumes of noxious green smoke spill from his fist and seep into the earth beneath him.
Third (hidden):  Plumes of noxious green smoke erupt midair and spill to the earth as an unseen voice incants.
You need only RAISE your certificate while holding a compatible object in your other hand.
Your certificate may not be altered or changed in any way.
The green smoke certificate will cost 99,999 coins.

Forest Armor may have either long and show descriptions.  The details are as follows:
ARMOR UNLOCKS
TIER 4

You will receive a greater awareness of your environmental surroundings.  In addition, you will experience heightened sensitivity to the shadows, light, and darkness.  Your survival instincts will become slightly elevated.  And finally, you will react more intuitively to irregularities in the terrain.  Your armor will occasionally call upon Wind Gust, Leaf Swirl, Mud Sling, and Woodland Empathy.  Current verbs are: CLEAN, EXHALE, GAZE, KNOCK, PRAISE, PULL, REMOVE, RUB, SENSE, SHAKE, TICKLE, TURN, and WEAR.
Armor can now be activated inside, outside, or in water, and spending time indoors will no longer cause your mithglin chain haubergeon to return to its natural state.
This mithglin chain haubergeon is Tier 4 of 4 Tiers.  Tier 4 is a rarer tier.  Forest Armor was first released at Briarmoon Cove 2016.
ENHANCIVE UNLOCKS
The PERCEPTION enhancive has not been unlocked but provides +1 to PERCEPTION.
The STALKING/HIDING enhancive has not been unlocked but provides +1 to STALKING/HIDING.
The SURVIVAL enhancive has not been unlocked but provides +1 to SURVIVAL.
The CLIMBING enhancive has not been unlocked but provides +1 to CLIMBING.

raw: The braided reed basrenne has an empty setting that looks ready to have a gem pushed into it.
Analysis of a tripartite braided reed basrenne indicates the creator has provided the following information:
This is the Racial Ferroniere that was first released in 5108 as part of the cultural and racial carts that wandered Mist Harbor.  It can only ever be altered into the following:
Aemikvai   - Giant          - The stone is always carved with a Saramar rune, and the setting is intricate knotwork.
Basrenne   - Forest Gnome   - Chain of woven or linked reeds which can be dyed. Gem is in its mostly natural state.
Elothrai   - Erithi         - Always uses an agate or an agita for the gem.
Ferrigem   - Burghal Gnome  - Chain uses bits and pieces of different metals, gem is in slivers or a shard, and a tiny gear or gadget is worked in somewhere.
Geldaralad - Elves          - Requires a twisted vaalin chain.
Khazurka   - Dwarf          - Mithril chain, cut gem, often very detailed.
Seer-stone - Human          - Oval-cut stone turned lengthwise to resemble a third eye.
Trinette   - Halfling       - Tri-stranded chain, trilliant-cut gem, and an elaborate setting.
For more information on the details of Ferroniere's you can go to:
https://gswiki.play.net/Ferroniere
Alter Instructions:
Please make sure that you remove the gemstone before giving this to an alterer to customize for you.
Please adhere to the rules above regarding this item.
Verbs: look, push (with gem in hand), pull (with empty hand), wear, and remove
The braided reed basrenne will cost 25,000 coins.

Analysis of a set of hawk-carved earcuffs indicates the creator has provided the following information:
~ Ear Candy ~

When worn, your hawk-carved earcuffs will temporarily alter your unique feature.  Earcuffs may be worn by any race, while earcaps are restricted to pointy ears (Elves, Half-elves, Dark Elves and Sylvankind).
You may PUSH a gem into your hawk-carved earcuffs to change its description.  PULL to remove the gem.
A merchant may alter the look of earcuffs for you, but no long descriptions; it'll just be overridden when a gem is inserted.  You may add a show description.  You may pluralize the earcuffs.
Currently, your hawk-carved earcuffs will display a gem in this manner: a set of hawk-carved earcuffs extending (gem) claws.
A willing merchant can customize that for you.
There is no custom feature set.  The default will be used: He has a set of hawk-carved earcuffs attached to his ears.
A willing merchant can customize that for you.

raw: This silver vellum looks interesting...  Perhaps you should read it.
Invoking this silver vellum will grant you permanent access to a special method of preparing your spells.
It will provide the following phrase:

First Person:  You carefully weave the [Spell Name] spell into the air, trails of indigo and silver mist following the somatic components.  Twisting and twining, the skeins of energy leech power from you and, as you unleash the spell, you feel droplets of moisture dripping from your fingertips...

Third Person:  Brodega carefully weaves his spell into the air, trails of indigo and silver mist following the somatic components.  Twisting and twining, the skeins of energy slip away from him, leaving moisture to drop from his fingertips...
Hidden or Invisible:  From somewhere nearby, the soft whisperings of a spell can be heard.
